intro: Hoffmannia leucocarpa, commonly known as the white-fruited hoffmannia, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a shrub characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by distinctive white, fleshy fruits. Hoffmannia leucocarpa is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodland or savanna habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
